Vulnerability.Title: mdadm bug fix update
Vulnerability.Description: The mdadm packages contain a utility for creating, managing, and monitoring Linux Multiple Disk devices. This update fixes the following bugs: Prior to this update, when the system was installed on an IMSM RAID array, a spare disk could not be added correctly to the array, because mdmon was unable to write metadata to it. With this update, spare disks are added correctly to the array as intended. (BZ#1132829) Previously, on a system with two IMSM RAID 5 arrays, if the system was rebooted during a reshape of the second array, the second array remained read-only and the reshape did not continue after the reboot. With this update, the reshape continues, and the array can be mounted read-write as intended. (BZ#1123031) Users of mdadm are advised to upgrade to these updated packages, which fix these bugs. Note for remediation: Please disable the SELinux for RHEL 4/5 when repairing, or some rpm packages will fail to install.
